title: Clemson University Summer Scholars (various 1-week courses)

time_commitment.schedule: Multiple 1-week sessions each summer (dates vary by course/session)

eligibility: Rising grades 7–12 (up to age 17 at time of camp); course-specific grade requirements
deadline_or_application_window: Registration opens mid-January; courses fill on a rolling basis
description: One-week immersive courses on Clemson’s campus across many fields (engineering, architecture, music production, etc.).

title: Summer Scholars: General Engineering (example course)

time_commitment.schedule: Offered in select 1-week summer sessions (see course schedule)

eligibility: High school grades vary by session/course; check course listing
description: Intro to multiple engineering disciplines with lab activities, tours, and STEM kits.

title: Clemson Bioengineering Pre-College: Summer Science for High School Students

time_commitment.schedule: One-week summer course (annual; dates posted by department)

eligibility: High school students (course-specific requirements apply)
deadline_or_application_window: Varies by year; typically spring/early summer
description: Week-long introduction to bioengineering with surgery class and multiple labs (e.g., bioinstrumentation, cell culture).

title: Prisma Health MedEx Academy (Tier I)

time_commitment.typical_hours_per_week: Program schedule set by cohort (often weekday-based)

eligibility: Rising high school seniors; GPA and other requirements may apply (see program page)
deadline_or_application_window: Applications typically open late fall; close in early spring
description: Healthcare immersion with exposure to clinical environments, professional development, and career exploration.

title: Prisma Health Youth Apprenticeship (CNA pathway)
eligibility: High school students in eligible districts; age and academic requirements apply (see program page)
description: Earn CNA training/experience while in high school through structured apprenticeship with clinical hours.

title: AnMed High School Summer Volunteer Program
eligibility: Completed 9th grade; at least 15 years old by start date
description: Hospital volunteering supporting staff and visitors (transport, restocking, errands).

title: Prisma Health Teen Volunteer Application (system-wide)

time_commitment.duration_weeks: Varies (summer + ongoing options depending on campus)

eligibility: Teen volunteer track for ages 14–17 (campus-specific requirements may apply)
deadline_or_application_window: Varies by campus; commonly spring intake for summer
description: Hospital volunteer opportunities across Prisma facilities (roles vary by location).

title: Vitruvian Health (Hamilton) Summer Teen Volunteer Program
eligibility: Ages 16–17 for the Summer Teen Volunteer program (see page for details)
description: Teen volunteer program in a healthcare setting; roles and schedules assigned by the site.

title: Pickens County Library System Volunteer Program
eligibility: Age 16+; parental consent required under 18
description: Library volunteer roles such as shelving/straightening, Adopt-a-Shelf, outreach support, and more.

title: Pickens County Library Teen Advisory Board
eligibility: Ages 12–18 enrolled in middle or high school
description: Help plan teen library programs and advise on services for teens.

title: Greenville County Library Teen Volunteer Options
eligibility: Teens (age requirements vary by activity/branch)
description: Teen service times and other volunteer roles supporting library events and operations.

title: The Children’s Museum of the Upstate Volunteer Program
organization: The Children’s Museum of the Upstate
eligibility: Teen and adult volunteers (age-specific roles may apply)
description: Help guests, support exhibits/programs, and assist museum operations.

title: Greenville Theatre Volunteers (front-of-house + backstage)
eligibility: Teens and adults (some roles may have age minimums)
description: Ushering, ticketing, concessions, set help, costumes, and more depending on needs.

title: Clemson Little Theatre (Pendleton Playhouse) Volunteers
eligibility: Open to community volunteers; minors need parent consent/supervision depending on task
description: Help with productions: ushering, sets, tech, costumes, and auditions for shows.

title: Greenville Zoo Volunteers (Teen opportunities)
eligibility: Teen volunteer roles available (training/orientation required; see zoo page)
description: Support education programs, engage visitors, and assist zoo operations.

title: Roper Mountain Science Center Volunteers
eligibility: Teen volunteers typically accepted with training; requirements vary by role
description: Help run science programs, public events, camps, and exhibit support.

title: City of Greenville Youth Commission
eligibility: High school students who live in or attend school in Greenville (see city page)
description: Youth advisory body that engages with city leadership and community issues.

title: Greenville County Youth Board (Phoenix Center)
eligibility: Rising 9th–12th graders in Greenville County (see Phoenix Center page)
description: Substance-use prevention youth board focused on leadership and community outreach.

title: Junior Leadership Pickens County
eligibility: High school juniors in Pickens County (selection-based; one per school typical)
description: Leadership development with community exposure to business, government, and civic life.

title: Junior Leadership Anderson
eligibility: High school juniors in Anderson area (selection-based)
description: Leadership program that explores community sectors and develops youth leadership skills.

title: YMCA Youth in Government (SC)
eligibility: High school students (grades 9–12) in SC (often through school delegations)
description: Model government program culminating in a statewide conference simulating SC government.

title: Palmetto Boys State
eligibility: Rising high school seniors (boys), selection-based
description: Week-long mock government leadership program with elections, legislation, and civic training.

title: Palmetto Girls State
eligibility: Rising high school seniors (girls), selection-based
description: Week-long mock government leadership program for young women.

title: Tri-County Technical College Maker Academy: Robotics (EIT Summer Workshop)
eligibility: Typically middle/high school students (see workshop listing for grade cutoffs)
description: Hands-on robotics workshop hosted by TCTC’s Engineering & Industrial Technology programs.

title: SC GSSM GoSciTech Day Camp (Tri-County Technical College location)
organization: SC Governor’s School for Science & Mathematics
eligibility: Middle/high school grade bands vary by course (see GoSciTech course list)
description: Day camp STEM courses hosted at technical colleges; includes TCTC as a location in posted schedules.

title: Anderson University Summer Institute: Art & Design (example offering)
eligibility: Rising grades 9–12 (for many institutes; verify per offering)
deadline_or_application_window: Varies by institute; register before capacity closes
description: Pre-college summer institutes across multiple areas (arts, film, music, business, engineering, etc.).

title: Anderson University Summer: Filmmaker’s Camp (example offering)
eligibility: High school-age students (see AU summer page)
deadline_or_application_window: Varies by camp; register before filled
description: Hands-on filmmaking camp exploring production, editing, and storytelling.

title: Anderson University Engineering Summer Institute (example listing)
eligibility: High school students interested in engineering (see registration page)
description: Engineering exposure through partner tours and hands-on engineering activities.

title: ACE Mentor Program (Architecture/Construction/Engineering) – Upstate SC
eligibility: High school students (grades 9–12) interested in A/C/E fields
description: Free mentorship program with industry professionals using a project-based design challenge.

title: Riley Institute Emerging Public Leaders (EPL)
organization: The Riley Institute at Furman University

time_commitment.typical_hours_per_month: Summer institute + year-long community project work

eligibility: Rising high school seniors in South Carolina (selection-based)
description: Leadership training + implementation of a community service project during senior year.

title: Michelin Youth Apprenticeship (Advanced Manufacturing)
eligibility: High school students in participating districts; selection-based
description: Paid youth apprenticeship combining work experience and training for manufacturing careers.

title: Youth Volunteer Corps (Anderson County)
eligibility: Youth ages 11–18 (see program page)
description: Organized youth service projects across the county with nonprofit partners.

title: City of Seneca Recreation Worker (sports officiating/operations)
eligibility: Must be at least 16 years old (see city listing)
description: Contract-based recreation work supporting sports leagues and events (paid per assigned duties).

title: Blood Drive Student Leadership (Student Scholarships / Drive Host)
eligibility: High school students (coordination with school/community site required)
description: Organize a blood drive; leadership experience and potential scholarship incentives based on collection goals.

title: Lifeguard – City of Clemson (Central/Clemson Recreation Center)
eligibility: Typically 15+ and certified lifeguard/CPR (verify on current posting)
description: Part-time lifeguard role at City recreation facilities (certifications required).

title: Clemson University Camps & Youth Programs Directory
eligibility: Varies widely by camp (grade/age dependent)
description: Central listing of Clemson-affiliated camps (academic, outdoor, athletics, etc.).

title: Carolina Youth Symphony
eligibility: Audition-based; youth musicians (typically middle/high school)
description: Youth orchestras with weekly rehearsals and performance schedule.

title: Civil Air Patrol Cadet Program (local squadron participation)
eligibility: Ages 12–18 (see CAP eligibility rules)
description: Leadership, aerospace education, and emergency services training for teens.

title: Big Brothers Big Sisters – High School Bigs
organization: Big Brothers Big Sisters of the Upstate

time_commitment.typical_hours_per_week: About 1 hour/week (school-based match time) + transportation time

eligibility: High school students (often juniors/seniors) at partner schools; training required
description: Mentor an elementary student through school-based weekly sessions.

title: SC Governor’s School for the Arts & Humanities – Summer Programs
organization: SC Governor’s School for the Arts & Humanities
eligibility: SC residents in specified grades (varies by program); audition/portfolio often required
description: Intensive residential summer arts training in multiple disciplines.

title: Ladder Internships (virtual internships with startups)
eligibility: High school students; cohort and project requirements vary
description: Remote internships with startups across many fields; mentorship and structured support.

title: NASA Internships (high school eligible opportunities vary)

time_commitment.typical_hours_per_week: Varies (often part-time or full-time by role)

eligibility: Some roles allow high school students; citizenship and academic requirements vary by posting
description: STEM internships and projects; filter for high school eligibility when applying.

title: Smithsonian Digital Volunteers (Transcription Center)
eligibility: Open to the public (including teens); account required
description: Transcribe historical documents to support open access and research.

title: Library of Congress By the People (crowdsourced transcription)
eligibility: Open to the public (including teens)
description: Transcription/annotation of LOC collections to improve accessibility.

title: Zooniverse (citizen science projects)
eligibility: Open to the public (project-specific requirements may apply)
description: Contribute to real research projects (astronomy, ecology, history) via microtasks.

title: Khan Academy Volunteer Translator
eligibility: Language proficiency required; teens can participate
description: Help translate educational content into other languages.

title: MIT App Inventor Community Contributions (open projects/help forums)
eligibility: Open to learners; teens welcome
description: Build apps and contribute via community support, tutorials, and project sharing.

title: FIRST Robotics (team participation + leadership roles)
eligibility: High school students (team-specific requirements)
deadline_or_application_window: Join at start of school year (typical)
description: Engineering competition experience; roles in CAD, programming, business, media, outreach.

title: Conrad Challenge (innovation/entrepreneurship competition)
eligibility: Ages 13–18 (see official rules)
description: Teams develop innovations in aerospace, cyber, health, energy, and more; pitch-based.

title: Technovation Girls (AI/tech entrepreneurship)
eligibility: Girls/non-binary youth (age bands vary by region)
description: Build a tech solution and pitch; includes mentorship and curriculum.

title: USACO (USA Computing Olympiad)
eligibility: Pre-college students
description: Algorithmic programming contests; great for building CS problem-solving skills.

title: Envirothon (South Carolina) – team-based environmental competition
eligibility: High school teams (check SC Envirothon host details)
description: Environmental science competition (soils, forestry, wildlife, aquatics, current issue).

title: Google Summer of Code (if eligible through open-source org + age rules)
eligibility: Eligibility rules apply and can change year-to-year; check official site
description: Paid open-source development with mentorship (eligibility varies).

title: National Speech & Debate Association (NSDA) competitions + leadership
eligibility: Member school team participation required
description: Competitive speech and debate with tournament travel and leadership roles.

title: DECA competitions + chapter leadership
eligibility: Join through your school’s DECA chapter
deadline_or_application_window: Join at start of school year (typical)
description: Business/marketing/finance competitions and leadership opportunities through DECA.
